title: Macbook Pro A1707 820-00281-A Dead after water damage
message: That macbook came to me after water damage , Pulling 0.006 on DCPS and when connect to the USB AMP Meter  only was showing 5.23v so i checked U3100 and U3200, so i have found resistor  R3033 which a [UPC_XA_HPD_RX] and R3034,[UPC_XA_HPD_RX]   and on both sides they measure 0.00v  so  I Thought that those were shorted and i removed and replaced them , as well as U3100 nd U3200 now i am getting on  R3033 And R3034 0.750ohms ,  Now i am getting the 20v on my amp meter but macbook is acting very weird , as i plug usb cable with amp meter , fan would promptly start spinning then stop then restarting again , but no image on screen , Can someone explain me what [UPC_XA_HPD_RX]  for and is it normal for their  reading 0.00ohms.

title: Macbook Pro A1707 820-00281-A Dead after water damage
message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

R3033/34 appear both as NO STUFF in schematic.
Did you really found them on the board?
If yes, what value did you place in their position.

Their pin 2 goes to ground, normal to get short to ground, don't you think?
Both are 100K, if were placed on the board.
I don't understand how can a resistor get shorted; unless it has low value as normal (not really short then).

Try to understand a schematic, or ask for help BEFORE changing things without reason.
Your power problem was U3100/200 related.

Does the board stay on after second restart?
Did you check for voltage on big coils?
USB activity present?

title: Macbook Pro A1707 820-00281-A Dead after water damage
message:
Thank you very much  for your prompt reply , Indeed You do have a point  , and i did find that later that those were not supposed to be removed and replaced , but i was very confused since the reading on the amp meter was giving 5.23v was thinking maybe those resistors were probably the one causing the issue , but apparantly Yes U3100/200 was my problem .

The board seems to stay on , cause i made a test with the battery connected and when i plug the usb cable i can hear the sound that  the power cable is connected but no image , no backlight on either screen nor keyboard.

when i test the big coils i am getting 0.00V

title: Macbook Pro A1707 820-00281-A Dead after water damage
message: USB activities , sometimes it would just turn off on the amp meter and then turn back on with 20V showing on amp meter but zero consumption

title: Macbook Pro A1707 820-00281-A Dead after water damage
message:
I talk about REAL USB activity, not power.
Get an USB pendrive with preinstalled macOS and Link LED; if flashes, there is 100% activity.

0V on all big coils???
Then no reason to search for image, nor USB activity.
But if fan spins, 5V is there at least.
And you heard even power sound!
I bet you have voltage on more coils...

title: Macbook Pro A1707 820-00281-A Dead after water damage
message: I Don't have a pendrive handy , I will Recheck all the coils again , now my how do i get  R3033/3034 To their original state since i am getting 0.765 ohms since they were supposed to be 0.00 ohm that was what I was getting initially when i  started diagnosing the macbook. Also do you have some specific coils do  i have to check or I have to check all of them?

title: Macbook Pro A1707 820-00281-A Dead after water damage
message:
L7030 getting 3.75v

L7660  3.35V  All the other ones are 0V

title: Macbook Pro A1707 820-00281-A Dead after water damage
message:
As I mentioned before, R3033/34 have 100K both; check schematic, please!!!
You've get 0 ohms before because of bad U3100/200.

How do you get power sound when connect charger, if no voltage on coils?
Nothing on L7600?
What about 3V3_SUS at least?

title: Macbook Pro A1707 820-00281-A Dead after water damage
message:
Hi , L7600 I was getting also 0V,  I did not check 3v3_SUS  , I will check that  too and get back to you  . In Regards of R3033/34  , I did not have a donor board to measure their resistance to compare , but funny thing about it , I changed U3100/200 First  then check Resistance of R3033/34 And was still 0V that was how i got confused , but with  that,  i was getting fan spinning then stopped but like i mentioned if battery is connected when connecting USB cable and connect it back that was when i was getting sound , But no display , no back light  on keyboard or screen , that was when i changed R3033/34 and since then i am getting fan spin but very prompt and stop then restart again  but this time with battery connected if i connect the cable , i am not getting the sound anymore. do you have any chance have a good working board if you would please give me the resistance value of R/3033/34 I know one side goes to ground but the positive sides.

Please

title: Macbook Pro A1707 820-00281-A Dead after water damage
message: I already said you two times; these are 100 Kohms resistors, exactly as in schematic.

Hello 

You were helping me last week with this macbook pro A1707  , I was able to figure out the issues and it got it fixed , but now there s a funny thing that i am getting and i am not able to figure it out , before i point anything out  I decided to first reach out to you for help.

Now all power rails are responding ok , but i am getting this weird backlight issue  which is very funny to me , when powering the device ,it turns on normal but then as soon as the keyboard lights up the lcd promptly shows apple logo booting for about 2 seconds then goes black , then promptly flashes back again then backlight goes off again , i cleaned the LCD fpc connector , it turned on normal so as soon as i disconnect the lcd connector and reconnect it i am getting the same , but keyboard backlight is working perfectly fine , now the other thing that i found funnier is if i disconnect the battery and connect the USB charger keyboard backlight  does not turn on,  but LCD showing normal backlight with battery  sign only . So  I am assuming that my backlight driver IC is working  , so can this issue relate to the battery or the flex that connect the lcd to the motherboard , i do not have  another flex cable  here to make a test. Please advice

Thank you.

title: Macbook Pro A1707 820-00281-A Dead after water damage
message:
Do you note any change if rotate the screen?
Test that, against classic flexgate issue.

Please, do NOT quote again on this manner...

title: Macbook Pro A1707 820-00281-A Dead after water damage
message: I apopologyse , I chose Reply that was why it came up that way  , When  i rotate it remains the same I can see image on the screen when shining with a bright light but no backlight, but as soon as i disconnect the battery and connect the charging cable  then I see normal back light and no light on keyboard but simply show the battery charging sign  , let me know if i can upload  a short video to show you the funny behaviour.

title: Macbook Pro A1707 820-00281-A Dead after water damage
message: Do you have any suggestions for me ? I have made two short videos to show you the behavior but i am not able to upload them here .

title: Macbook Pro A1707 820-00281-A Dead after water damage
message:
Check if backlight is steady, disconnecting keyboard flex.
There could be a Hall sensor issue.

title: Macbook Pro A1707 820-00281-A Dead after water damage
message: I was made a discover i found a missing transistor which happens to be Hall_Sensor_Left  and a small capacitor missing  at  J5250, would that be art of my issue?

title: Macbook Pro A1707 820-00281-A Dead after water damage
message: Probably, as the Hall sensor is related with sleep function.

title: Macbook Pro A1707 820-00281-A Dead after water damage
message: I am waiting on couple of donor boards since i could not get that transistor from any other donor boards , I will replace the transistor and let you know how it goes.

message: Did you test disconnecting keyboard flex???

title: Macbook Pro A1707 820-00281-A Dead after water damage

title: Macbook Pro A1707 820-00281-A Dead after water damage
message:
Exactly what You said was what my problem was , as soon as i replaced the missing triode and the cap , everything went back to normal, Thank you so much , but i have another one A1989 Came in water damage , on my amp meter i am getting the 20v , i can see that its charging ok  when the battery is connected , but The T2 is getting hot and its not booting , PPBUS_G3H is ok , I wonder if you can guide me please on that one.

Thank you.

title: Macbook Pro A1707 820-00281-A Dead after water damage
message:
As I replaced the hall sensor triode and capacitor  all system is back to normal , thank you for all your support.

I got a macbook A1989 came in dead water damage , i am getting 20v on my amp meter , T2 is getting hot , if i connect the battery i can see that it is charging but no boot ,  Please help me , I looked for short to ground everywhere but result into no short found.
